text: West Kelowna, sometimes known as Westbank, is a city in British Columbia located on the west shore of the Okanagan Lake. West Kelowna is formed in 2007 as a municipality known as Westside from 2007 to 2009. After January 2009, the municipality's name was changed from Westside to West Kelowna. The municipality became a city on June 2015. The population of the city is about 36,078 as of 2021. ==Related pages== *Kelowna ==Other websites== * Category:Cities in British Columbia
title: West Kelowna
